ptserver.data.handler

Class StringTokenHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptserver.data.handler.StringTokenHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TokenHandler<StringToken>

    public class StringTokenHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements TokenHandler<StringToken>
    StringTokenHandler converts StringToken to/from byte stream.
    Since:
    Ptolemy II 10.0
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    ishwinde
    Accepted Rating:
    Red (ishwinde)
    Proposed Rating:
    Red (ishwinde)

      • convertToBytes

        public void convertToBytes(StringToken token,
                           java.io.DataOutputStream outputStream)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Convert StringToken to a byte stream using an algorithm defined in the DataOutputStream.
        Specified by:
        convertToBytes in interface TokenHandler<StringToken>
        Parameters:
        token - The token to be converted to the byte stream.
        outputStream - The byte stream to write the token to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If cannot write to the stream.
        See Also:
        TokenHandler.convertToBytes(ptolemy.data.Token, java.io.DataOutputStream)

      • convertToToken

        public StringToken convertToToken(java.io.DataInputStream inputStream,
                                  java.lang.Class<? extends StringToken> tokenType)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads from the inputStream and converts it to the StringToken.
        Specified by:
        convertToToken in interface TokenHandler<StringToken>
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The stream that contains the token.
        tokenType - The type of the token. Should be StringToken or it's derivatives.
        Returns:
        The token that arrived on the stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the stream cannot be read.
        See Also:
        TokenHandler.convertToToken(java.io.DataInputStream, Class)
